Package ohos.multimodalinput.event

Class MouseEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.multimodalinput.event.MultimodalEvent
      • ohos.multimodalinput.event.CompositeEvent
        • ohos.multimodalinput.event.MouseEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public abstract class MouseEvent
extends CompositeEvent
    Reports mouse events.

    A reported event can contain both mouse button state change and cursor state change.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    CompositeEvent
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.MultimodalInput#MULTIMODAL_INPUT

      Indicates the movement of the mouse pointer or scroll wheel in the X axis.

      Indicates the movement of the mouse pointer or scroll wheel in the Z axis.

      Indicates that the back button on the mouse is pressed.
      static int FORWARD_BUTTON
      Indicates that the forward button on the mouse is pressed.
      static int HOVER_ENTER
      Indicates that a mouse button is not pressed while the cursor moves into the window or view.
      static int HOVER_EXIT
      Indicates the exit of the cursor from a window or view when the left mouse button is not pressed.

      Indicates the movement of the cursor in a window or view when the left mouse button is not pressed.

      Indicates that the left button on the mouse is pressed.

      Indicates the movement of the cursor in a window or view when the left mouse button is pressed.

      Indicates no mouse action.

      Indicates that no mouse button is pressed.
      static int PRESS
      Indicates that a mouse button is pressed.
      static int RELEASE
      Indicates that a mouse button is released.
      static int RIGHT_BUTTON
      Indicates that the right button on the mouse is pressed.

    • Method Detail

      • getAction

        public abstract int getAction​()
        Obtains the mouse action.
        Returns:
        Returns the mouse action. The return value can be PRESS, RELEASE, MOVE, HOVER_ENTER, HOVER_MOVE, or HOVER_EXIT.
        Since:
        1

      • getActionButton

        public abstract int getActionButton​()
        Obtains the mouse button whose status has changed.
        Returns:
        Returns the mouse button whose status has changed. The return value can be NONE_BUTTON, LEFT_BUTTON, RIGHT_BUTTON, MIDDLE_BUTTON, BACK_BUTTON, or FORWARD_BUTTON. Note that NONE_BUTTON indicates that there is no mouse button whose status has changed.
        Since:
        3

      • getPressedButtons

        public abstract int getPressedButtons​()
        Obtains all mouse buttons in the pressed state.
        Returns:
        Returns all mouse buttons in the pressed state. The return value can be NONE_BUTTON, or the result of logical OR operations among LEFT_BUTTON, RIGHT_BUTTON, MIDDLE_BUTTON, BACK_BUTTON, and FORWARD_BUTTON. Note that NONE_BUTTON indicates that there is no mouse button in the pressed state.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        NONE_BUTTON, LEFT_BUTTON, RIGHT_BUTTON, MIDDLE_BUTTON, FORWARD_BUTTON

      • getCursor

        public abstract MmiPoint getCursor​()
        Obtains the current position of the mouse pointer.
        Returns:
        Returns the current position of the mouse pointer.
        Since:
        3

      • setCursorOffset

        public abstract void setCursorOffset​(float offsetX,
                                     float offsetY)
        Sets the offset position relative to the screen.
        Parameters:
        offsetX - Indicates the offset relative to the x on the upper left corner of the screen.
        offsetY - Indicates the offset relative to the y on the upper left corner of the screen.
        Since:
        3

      • getCursorDelta

        public abstract float getCursorDelta​(int axis)
        Obtains the movement of the mouse pointer in the given direction since last call.
        Parameters:
        axis - Indicates the movement direction of the mouse pointer. The value can be AXIS_X, AXIS_Y, or AXIS_Z.
        Returns:
        Returns the movement of the mouse pointer in the given direction since last call.
        Since:
        3

      • getScrollingDelta

        public abstract float getScrollingDelta​(int axis)
        Obtains the movement of the scroll wheel in the given direction since last call.
        Parameters:
        axis - Indicates the movement direction of the scroll wheel. The value can be AXIS_X, AXIS_Y, or AXIS_Z.
        Returns:
        Returns the movement of the scroll wheel in the given direction since last call.
        Since:
        3
